title: Phoenix_Service_Software_2011_2_0_44842 - Cracked
description:

MAIN CHANGES & ERROR CORRECTIONS FROM PREVIOUS VERSION 2010.48.4.44602
New Products added
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ RM-732, RM-733, RM-713, RM-707
New features
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ New Connectivity Cable deriver
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ New version of FUSE connection Manager
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ New version of Flash Update Package
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ New versions of Product API
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ CTRL+R and CTRL+S shortcuts corrected
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ All Nokia Service SOftware Applications will use following location for product specific data:
- Windows XP: C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data\Nokia\Packages
- Windows 7: C:\Program Data\Nokia\Packages
Error Corrections & changes
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ FLS-4 Support removed
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Correction to Genius case #173131: Nokia 7020 Auto-tuning failed issue
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Corrections to autotuning / certificate restoring in cases when flash / combo memory was been
replaced and security self tests were failing
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ New look & feel implemented to UI
Please note:
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ This version contains the latest Tucson components. Therefore it is not necessary to use Tucson
Add-On Installation Packages
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Before you start Phoenix or care Suite installation to Windows 7 the User Account Control (UAC)
should be turned off from Windows Control Panel settings.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ For more information concerning new common data package location refer to separate documentation
in KICS information center
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ For more information concerning new options in ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œFirmware UpdateÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ menu, please refer to document
SR1313 in KICS information center.
Current options in Firmware Update UI:
- Refurbish: Software will be updated with required content files. User data will be deleted. It is
mandatory to have the content files installed on PC, otherwise Refurbishment process will be
terminated. Before refurbishing, ensure that you back up user data with PC Suite.
- Update Software: Updates software. User data will be preserved. Optional Content files are not
required because they are not programmed
- Reset Software: Updates software and resets settings to the factory defaults. Some user data can be
lost.Optional Content files are not required because they are not programmed
- Product Code changes for USB Only ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ phones (RX-51, RM-596 etc) work only when used with FPS-21
Flash Prommer and USB connection from prommer rear panel to phone. Please select USB as Product
Active Media
- Do not use Flash option simultaneously with product code change for USB Onbly phones, flash phone
separately with Firmware Update
- It is recommeneded to use FPS-21 flash prommer with TCPIP connection when refurbishing USB Only
- phones (RM-596 etc) due to mandatory optional MMC file size.
KNOWN ERRORS & LIMITATIONS
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Software downgrade with Tucson system is only possible for BB 5.0 products supporting the Data
Package 2 concept.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Flashing with setup FLS-5, SS-46 and product specific adapter is not supported anymore
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ If you install old DCT-4 data packages, Flash Update Package File installation path may be wrong. This
is caused by very old DCT-4 data packages which contain Flash Update Package and overwrite current
information during installation. If you experience problems when updating FPS-x prommers, please
check that Phoenix ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œPrommer maintenanceÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ is looking for the files from the correct location which is
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œC:\Program Files\Common Files\Nokia\Tss\FlashÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½. If not, Phoenix will show error ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œUpdate via ini ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ file
failedÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½. In this case, select ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œUpdateÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ from that Phoenix ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œPrommer maintenanceÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ UI, browse to correct
directory and select ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œfpsxupd.iniÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ for all other prommers except the FPS-8.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Refurbishment flashing and product code change for RX-51 product requires SX-4 card to be available
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ FPS-21 flashing for RX-51 works only with TCPIP connection. FPS-21 prommer with new HW version
is needed to correct this, and it is estimated to be available by the end of 2010
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Please refer to product specific documents and instructions concerning the limitations of the RX-51
product
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ RX-51 flashing does not work when CU-4 is used
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ RX-51 Product Code changes work only without FLASH option, please flash phone separately
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ When version 2010_12_8_42304 or newer with FUSE connection manager is installed on top of older
Phoenix versions, there may be an additional delay of several minutes when you start Phoenix for the
first time. Please wait patiently; Phoenix will start after configuration is finished.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ When using Data Package download functions with online connection, download times may
occasionally be long. This is not caused by Phoenix (or Care Suite). The download speed from online
servers is occasionally is known to be slow, depending on how data is buffered on caching servers.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Note concerning the installation and use with Administrator and User rights
- If you install Phoenix, start Phoenix and configure connections from FUSE connection manager as
Administrator, you may not be able to start Phoenix after you log off and try to use Phoenix with User
Rights afterwards
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ If you experience the above mentioned problem:
- Log on as Administrator
- Deleted Fuse folder and its contents from: C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application
Data\Nokia\
- After this FuseÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s connection list will be empty and it can be used directly with guest/admin rights.
- This has to be done only once.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ After you close Phoenix, it may not restart. To rectify this:
- Use Windows Task Manager to manually shut down phoenix.exe and FuseService.exe processes, or
optionally restart your PC
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Mass memory content file flashing does not work for all products over USB ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ FPS-10 or FPS-21 Flash
Prommer must be used!
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ To be able to use the help files in Windows 7 you need to install Windows Help program
(WinHlp32.exe) for Windows 7. Ways to locate WinHlp32.exe:
- Start Phoenix with online connection to Internet, select ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œHelpÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ and ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œPhoenix helpÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½. Click the
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œMicrosoft Help and SupportÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ website link. Download WinHlp32 and install it.- Go to <a href="
http://www.microsoft.com" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.microsoft.com</a> (http://www.microsoft.com) . Type ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œWinHlp32ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â³ to ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œSearch Microsoft.comÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ field. Locate
Windows Help program (WinHlp32.exe) for Windows 7 and install it
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ When using flash prommers, only one connection type to one prommer is allowed. Please use either
NFPD USB or NFPD TCPIP connection to one prommer, not both connections to same prommer
Supported operating systems and user rights
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Windows XP Service Pack 1 or higher
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ When installing Phoenix into Win XP you must have local admin rights.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ When using in Win XP, user must have power user rights.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Windows 7 32 Bit version
